meanings.sent1: She accidentally misframed the picture on the wall.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misframe the information in your report.
meanings.sent3: He misframed the joke, making everyone laugh at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: The detective realized the suspect had misframed his alibi.
meanings.sent5: The artist's attempt to misframe reality resulted in a surreal painting.

meanings.definition: A frame that is incorrect or faulty.
meanings.sent1: The misframe around the door caused it to stick.
meanings.sent2: The mirror had a misframe that made it look crooked.
meanings.sent3: The misframe on the painting gave it a quirky charm.
meanings.sent4: The misframe of the window distorted the view outside.
meanings.sent5: The misframe of the glasses made them uncomfortable to wear.
